source.author: Henwood, M.J.; Makinson, R.O.; Maling, K.L.
source.title: Araliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Henwood, M.J.; Makinson, R.O.; Maling, K.L. (1999). Araliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves 1–4 (–7) mm wide, upper surface distinctly asperate (fine roughness detectable with fingernail); petals of terminal (primary) umbel pale yellow-green, petals of the other (lateral) umbels white to cream; non-basal bracts of umbels c. linear (1.0–) 2.5–6 mm long; anthers 1.0–1.5 mm long

Leaves 6–11 mm wide, upper surface microscopically granulate or very finely wrinkled to almost smooth; petals of the terminal (primary) umbel pale pink to mauve or white, petals of other (lateral) umbels white to cream, occasionally becoming purple; non-basal bracts of umbels linear to subulate or narrowly triangular, 1–2.5 mm long, anthers 0.6–1.3 mm long
